content: needle 2 so that you have 15 sts on needles 2 and 3 gusset decreases when working the gusset decreases you will decrease every other round until you have 15 sts on each needle for a total of 60 sts round 1 needle 1 knit to the last 3 sts k2tog k1 needles 2 and 3 knit needle 4 k1 ssk knit to end of needle round 2 knit all around repeat these 2 rounds until there are 15 sts on each needle work in stockinette stitch for 6 inches or to desire length this is the foot of the sock toe decreases decrease every other round until 20 sts remain round 1 needle 1 knit to last 3 sts k2tog k1 needle 2 k1 ssk knit remaining sts needle 3 knit to last 3 sts k2tog k1 needle 4 k1 ssk knit remaining sts round 2 knit all around 2 when you have 8 sts on each needle combine sts on needles 2 and 3 continue in decrease pattern all your stitches are now on 3 needles when you have 5 sts on needles 1 and 3 and 10 sts on needle 2 you have completed your decreases knit sts from needle 1 onto needle 3 you should now have 10 sts on each of 2 needles cut yarn leaving an 8-inch tail graft stitches together using kitchener stitch for an excellent tutorial on the kitchener stitch go to https //www knittinghelp com/video/play/kitchener-stitch weave in all ends on the inside of the sock for all the socks i have ever knit i have used a wonderful pattern called basic recipe for adult ribbed socks on double point needles this pattern was written by my friends and former co-workers kathy and dianne of ewe & i originals i have borrowed heavily from their pattern to create these socks if you can find a copy of this pattern anywhere i highly recommend it everything you need to know about knitting socks can be found there copyright 2023 anne mancine 3
